website_summaries.verdict: A customer favorite that could steer you from ever eating a frozen waffle again.
pros: We love the ceramic finish, which means there's no chemical coating to interfere with the waffles
With a single flip, cooks waffles in about four minutes
Stands upright and is easy to store
High marks even after a few years of use
cons: Lasted just a few weeks for some users

website_summaries.verdict: If you're leery of traditional nonstick coating, consider this ceramic nonstick flip-style waffle maker.
pros: Professional-style rotating design with extra-thick grid
Makes 7-inch diameter waffles in four easy-to-cut sections
Dual function base allows rotation for baking and locks for storage
Lights and sounds let you know when waffles are done
cons: If your waffles stick, try a recipe that uses a litlte more oil or butter
Be aware that the timer needs a separate battery

customer_reviews.title: sending back
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed! Brand new, out of the box it worked. It made probably, 7 waffles. Then it stopped. No heat, no waffles. I have the feeling this item was already returned once. It was not in original packaging and the box was taped (badly). I should have known then. I am returning this and trying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great waffles
customer_reviews.text: I kept thinking back to those hotel Belgain waffles and wasn't excited about this purchase, but my fiance wanted one, so I figured I'd get a highly rated model. But if you have some good batter, and not the cheap stuff a hotel uses, this makes a really great waffle. Make sure to pick up some whipped cream and make some blueberry compote! Oh, one thing that I did dislike was the Timer does not have a second button like shown in the picture. It is also not 'built-in' to the device. It is a removable timer that requires us to replace Batteries over time?? I don't remember reading about that anywhere, so I have to go with 4-stars.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: No Joy and Uncooked Waffles
customer_reviews.text: We were excited about this Belgian waffle iron. It stands upright requiring less countertop or cupboard space. Initially it did well. Indicator light to signal when ready for batter, timer (operates independently via a small battery), good nonstick surfaces and even top and bottom heating. Update. Two months later? All great except for the most crucial role of a waffle iron. The bottom plate no longer heats. At All. Zippo. Warranty out. Choices? Heat waffle iron until indicator light goes out. Pour in half usual amount of batter. Let cook for 17 minutes. Open lid. Flip waffle. Close lid until cooked. Or? Trash can and curses upon ATROCIOUS Presto Belgian waffle iron.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad for a Family, but Good for Single People
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and feel of this waffle maker, but it takes 6 min to make a light golden brown waffle. If you are only making a waffle for one person, this product is great, but if you have to make them for family or friends, I recommend you buy one with a temperature setting. I sent mine back and bought one with a temp setting. Family can now enjoy waffles together.
customer_reviews.author: collegegrad

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several waffle makers over the years and make waffles quite often. I was excited to receive this one and thought he fact that it has a timer and no temp controls would be a good thing. Despite following the directions verbatim, including seasoning the iron, not using spray coating and switching up the time the same thing happed even if I left them in for just two minutes- they waffles split and stick to the irons on each side. Two batches of waffle mix wasted testing different ways to make this work.- Finally I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Sad...
customer_reviews.text: So sad... This waffle maker has great reviews, but is terrible. Perhaps defective? It was purchased to replace a simple Oster Belgian Waffle iron we've had since our wedding 26 years ago that suddenly stopped getting hot. This machine barely cooked the waffle after more than 10 minutes. Bummer! Returning. The search for a replacement continues...
customer_reviews.author: Kaygee

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and great at first. However, I have gone through twofold these in about 6 years of light use. With both, the heating mechanism wore out so they stopped cooking waffles with high enough heat to be crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. I will now buy a more expensive waffle iron that will last longer than a couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: DC Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great waffle maker!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first waffle maker and I had zero problems making my first batch as you can see. Directions were very easy to follow. I didn't leave my waffles in for the full 4 minutes, mine were done in about 3. The waffles in the pictures were made with 1 cup of batter per waffle and I had no problems with it leaking. Clean up was a breeze just a few crumbs and into the cabinet it went. If you're on the fence, give this one a shot!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Presto rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Belgian waffle maker! We've had a Presto griddle for years, and it's truly my favorite kitchen 'thing. We use it at least once a week and it still looks and work like brand new. So when we wanted to upgrade from our old Farberware (sqaure, thin waffles) non-flip maker, I checked to see if Presto had a Belgian waffle maker, and found this. Used it for the first time this morning and YAY! Followed the recipe in the instruction booklet and the flavor was meh- will use a different recipe or a mix next time, but the waffles were thick, fluffy and so easy to make! No stick, deep pockets for butter and syrup, and just, yay! Thanks Presto.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: QUIT AFTER ONE USE - DON'T BELIEVE THE REVIEWS - there are better ones out there
customer_reviews.text: This is not the first waffle maker I've owned. Used this once---tried several recipes - does not produce a fluffy waffle--altered steaming time--still not up to par. On attempting to use today---plugged in -- did not heat up.Thinking it might be the outlet (same I use for toaster) moved it around---still nothing. Would return it but due to the corona situation--discarded all outer wrappings. Waste of money. Made great pancakes with the batter I could not use on the cold non-functioning waffle iron.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Golden Brown & Crispy Waffles
customer_reviews.text: After the flipping mechanism linkage failed on my previous waffle iron, I purchased this Presto model from Amazon. The flipping action is easier on this waffle maker than my previous one, and it makes delicious crispy waffles. No non-stick spray is needed or recommended. Clean up is simple....just wipe with a paper towel. It has a built-in timer which beeps when done, but it does not turn off the waffle iron so you need to be on hand to take your waffle off the iron when it's done. Four stars and not five because of no temperature control, and sometimes uneven heat distribution.
customer_reviews.author: Rick in Northern AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Ceramic Coating, NO Oil Required
customer_reviews.text: Someone had posted a video about waffling eggs on Facebook. I did it for the second time today. I love my Presto Flipside waffle maker. I use NO oil on the griddle, or in my batters, except for the butter that was called for when I made my corn dog waffles (third photo). The first photo is a completed egg waffle (two eggs, beaten, with about a cup of spinach, edible flowers, and Thai basil added). The second photo shows the egg and greens mixture just added to the waffle maker. After use, I place a wet paper towel between the plates, and close the waffle iron, letting it steam clean as it cools. Then I just wipe it off.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K.

customer_reviews.title: Makes nice, thick waffles
customer_reviews.text: Unless you yourself want temperature control this waffle maker is darn near perfect. I have a warning for other users because of my own experience.........DON'T USE PAN SPRAY! This waffle maker's non stick coating is awesome and if you use pan spray is will burn away and leave an oily residue on your waffles. you don't need any kind non stick anything, once the waffle is cooked enough and sufficiently crispy you can pull out the waffle with your hands or a fork. If you happen to overflow it, cut off the excess then pull your waffle out. I clean it up while still warm with a single paper towel
customer_reviews.author: Nick Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as previous one purchased - terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I own one of these that still works great that I bought from years ago. I needed a second one, so ordered the same thing because I love my old one. The surface material has been changed and the new one is terrible! Won't brown the waffles at all, and I didn't test it until it was too late to return it, so now I have a $40 paperweight. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Laurin Davis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Waffle Maker.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about this product because I did not know the brand but I am very happy to have bought it. My daughter is a waffle fan and the first thing she did was read the instructions and make two full waffle batches, the result was perfect waffles in each use. Something very important, as it is ceramic does not need to add any type of oil, that would damage the surface. I really recommend this product and it is something that for the price is worth it, you will get waffles equal to those of the hotels. The best purchase so far. I will update with some photos.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Luis Rivero Perez

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for your buck Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to get a new waffle maker when my old one broke and did a lot of research and the really good ones according to all the research were more expensive, but this was always a consistent recommend. This is definitely worth it over the $15 or $20 ones. It came out of the box with no smell of any sort and cleaned up real well before first use. I made a waffle and it came out nice and fluffy with no burn marks of any sort, but had nice color. I'd recommend this waffle maker to anyone trying to get a new one or there old one broke.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Pham

customer_reviews.title: So far so good - love the result
customer_reviews.text: I saw this reviewed on America's Test Kitchen on PBS and they gave it high marks.When it arrived, I had to put this into service immediately so tried my first batch with a commercial mix. I quickly found out why you need to flip it over after pouring in the batter. I forgot on the second waffle and it wasn't baked evenly. Perfect waffles at exactly 4 minutes as stated by other reviewers. So far so good. The only thing I might mention is the plastic part that holds the waffle iron upright when not in use seems a bit flimsy, but time will tell. Absolutely non-stick and very easy to just wipe clean.
customer_reviews.author: J48

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Belgian Waffle Maker - NO STICK-Pefect Waffles every time
customer_reviews.text: Our old Krups waffle maker didn't have the deep cavities and was NOT non-stick (tried everything) This one is great - waffles always pop out, even cooking.Followed what other reviewers said, and we never pre-oil/butter the grill plate. (butter/oil in mix is fine) Heats up really fast - don't preheat too long, doesn't need it Love the timer feature - we use 2-3 per side the con - as others mentioned - this is a non-stick surface, and has an odor when heats up. I put the fan on. It's not horrible, but this is the only Teflon thing we own. Doesn't affect taste.
customer_reviews.author: USHKJ

customer_reviews.title: and it works pretty well. I just am a bit concerned about ...
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I ordered the "Ceramic" waffle maker, but instead received the unit with the black non-stick coating. That is NOT the one that I ordered! I tried it out anyway, and it works pretty well. I just am a bit concerned about the non-stick teflon coating and really would have preferred to have the ceramic coating. Couldn't be bothered with the hassle of an exchange. Hopefully, Amazon will be more aware of which products they are sending to their customers in the future. Plus, this is not the first time that I've heard about this happening. I have friends who have also had incorrect orders sent to them too.
customer_reviews.author: Bogey17

customer_reviews.title: NOT A NEW MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: I paid for what I thought was going to be a new machine. What I got was apparently used. There were scratches on the face of the machine. It also looked like there was a smudge of dough left on the underside. This is not acceptable. I'm going to try it to see if it actually cooks well. If it does, I may amend my review. It still was USED.
customer_reviews.author: BHers

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this waffle iron to replace the small square one I'd had for over 10 years and was not performing well any longer. I decided on this one because it could be flipped after adding batter and also because it stores upright saving precious counter space. It performs very well! I read reviews before buying and have not had any of the issues listed thus far. My waffles don't stick (yet) and it only takes about 2 to 3 minutes to heat up and another 2-3 minutes to cook the waffle. I have used it at least 20 times since purchase. I really like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Susan

customer_reviews.title: Very very basic machine
customer_reviews.text: Makes good waffles. I got it couple of months ago and have used it hardly 5 to 6 times. Within that short usage, the timer component or is that a heat adjustment knob Whatever that is stopped working. If you’re a person who relies on timer and heat adjustment than you might want to invest in a more sophisticated waffle maker. I am not, so I just put my mixture and after 6 to 7 minutes check if its done. So it works for me. But, it is disappointing and frustrating when electronic products have silly buttons and settings that never work.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in September 2017 and its now October 2019 and the waffle make has died. I rarely used it and it was stored properly. Today was the worst day for it t0 die. This should have lasted longer with the minimal use I've given it.
customer_reviews.author: Beadgirl

customer_reviews.title: Just what we wanted!
customer_reviews.text: We used Krusteaz Belgian waffle mix, which made waffles in three minutes! We did allow the waffle maker to burn off for about 10 minutes before using it the first time, and also threw away the first waffle to be safe. SUPER easy to clean; we heeded the directions about not using any cooking spray on the waffle iron. Saves storage space due to upright lock. Has all the benefits of a flip waffle iron without the large stand. Very happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: lynniemn

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied but the best I could get !
customer_reviews.text: Every brand has cost down their waffle makers and scarifies quality with it ! This one is so far I can bear with it. Pro: Nonstick surface is evenly coating, 1100W power is enough and heat up fast. Flipside design is good for Belgian waffle. Take less space than other brands. Con: Not evenly cooking on waffle. It needs constantly monitor when cooking otherwise, some area will be over burnt. Less plastic burnt smell than some makers, but still has little. The edge of handle that contacts with hot iron generates that smell.
customer_reviews.author: WanFeng Teng

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Ceramic Coated Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker is, hands down, the best one I have ever used. It is very easy to use and includes a timer for you to set and monitor so waffles are not burned or undercooked. I am impressed by its flip side feature which allows waffles to be cooked fully on both sides. Once done, waffles come out fluffy, with perfect texture and moisture, and do not stick to the surface of the waffle maker! Moreover, the inside of the wafer maker is coated with ceramic as a nonstick surface, which is a healthier and less harmful alternative to teflon. I would recommend this product to all who want to make fluffy waffles at home like I do. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Mao

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, no sticking!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this once and am so happy! It took awhile to find a non-toxic ceramic one so I was glad to find this one at this price point. No oils or spray needed or suggested, just a moist paper towel before use and after it’s cooled and done. So happy!
customer_reviews.author: cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Best Waffle Maker Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best waffle maker I have ever owned and over the years I've had about 3 others. This is compact and fairly light weight. I like that it can be stored upright and doesn't take up much space. The batter does not drip out when you flip it provided you haven't overfilled it. (I use 3/4 to 1 c. batter.) There is a timer on it and it makes perfect waffles every time in about 4 minutes. If you want a crispier waffle, I'd leave it another minute. I am really happy with it. I bought it to replace a Toastmaster low profile rotating waffle maker--stay away--it was horrible--batter dripped out when I rotated it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Works for about 3 mos. and then everything sticks.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about the first 2 1/2 mos. Last few times, nothing I did changed - same batter, same cleaning (just basically wipe out with damp paper towel), and waffles began to stick. First the top of the waffle would not come down off the iron. Everything was stuck to the top. Now neither side will come loose and the whole waffle is in pieces to get out. Very disappointed since we were enjoying it in the beginning. Now too late to return and I will have to find another. Will have to research other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling45

customer_reviews.title: After 4.5 years, it has died. The generic one hasn't.
customer_reviews.text: 3.5. We bought this in July 2013, and we've used it alongside a generic animal shaped waffle iron from the late 1990s I picked up at a drug store. They both worked great, though this was slower and stuck more often than the animal one. The animal one is still going, however this one has died. So, for what it's worth, this one may not be in it for the long haul off you want longevity. Go team generic!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Ceramic makes SUCH a difference
customer_reviews.text: I don't see any need to look for anything other than this waffle maker. Zero need to pre-grease the plates. Heats up very quickly. Pour directly in the center of the plates, close the lid and flip. 4 minutes later a perfectly done waffle that lifts out leaving no mess on the grids. It seriously takes longer to cool off so you can wipe the plates down with a paper towel than it does to heat and cook. Love the fact that it can store upright saving shelf space in the pantry! Waffles are no longer just for weekend breakfasts!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Highly satisfied. Works great. Waffles do not stick. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I have been cooking for more years than I care to think on. We are not and never have been much on eating out. Take home - no problem. I prefer my homeade pancakes, which my husband loves. But he likes waffles because the butter and syrup sit in the holes . This was my first time making waffles, and first time owning a waffle maker. It went like a breeze and they turned out perfect. I highly recommend this waffle maker. I spent quite a bit of time looking at all available waffle makers and settled on this one. I wanted something simple stupid to use and won't stick and is easy to clean up and I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Oceans

customer_reviews.title: Excellent waffle Iron. BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: Our 10 year old waffle Iron died and we've been on the hunt for a new one. We purchased two others, one of which had Teflon coated grates, which I refuse to cook with, and the other was sloppily manufactured, and terrible quality. This thing is amazing. It requires no oil/butter/spray to avoid sticking, they just don't stick. They make beautiful evenly cooked waffles that are soft and fluffy on the inside and crispy on the outside. You'll be hard pressed to find a better waffle Iron. Some people have complained about the timer, but I find it easy to load, flip and start timer, then I continue on with whatever I'm doing and wait for the audible alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Ether

customer_reviews.title: A good Belgium waffle maker and great storage saver
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was temp control, but other than that, this is a very good Belgium waffle maker. The storage upright option makes this a top selection although it is a pretty cheap peice of plastic that holds the two sides in the upright position, it seems well enough to withstand normal use. Rough use will break this fairly easily in my opinion though. The cord is a decent length and the timer is okay, although I would rather something a little more sophisticated than a simple digital one.
customer_reviews.author: Fanamazon

customer_reviews.title: Looks used
customer_reviews.text: There were two boxes. The outside Amazon box was intact. The inside box was for the Belgian Waffle Maker. The inside, waffle maker box had a deep cut down the middle that looked like it was made by a knife. The waffle maker was in a plastic bag and everything looked good when I first took it out. After reading the instructions, I was got ready to make my first batch of waffles. I noticed the inside of the waffle maker looked dirty. It had waffle crumbs and stains as if it had been used before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Non-Stick Coating Failed after 3 1/2 Years
customer_reviews.text: My waffles started sticking after 3.5 years of once a week use. I bought the black version on Amazon in March of 2016. The non-stick coating is now rough to the touch, even though I use a soft sponge for clean-up. Temperature control seems Ok, although the timer failed after the 1st year. Preconditioning with paper towel soaked olive oil did not work, and cooking spay is no longer effective. I am buying the Hamilton Beach model with removable non-stick copper ceramic plates for easier cleaning and conditioning.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Kimball

customer_reviews.title: It’s not bad at all!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this waffle maker!! Keyword like. Now that it’s being used more often... it’s starting to stick a little... but it’s only a LITTLE!! I can still pull the waffle out without ruining it! We have used it maybe 7-8 times since we bought it less than 2 months ago. But it really is a great waffle maker! I had the craving for waffles for a month and cracked and bought one of these bad boys!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley De Leon

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend, Makes perfect waffles
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research before finally choosing this waffle maker. It is fantastic. I typically only cook the waffles for about 2 minutes in it and they come out perfect. Found a great belgium waffle recipe from a site called Salty Marshmallow. Wife and I are thrilled. Since everything comes right off you dont really have anything to clean on it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Jablonowski

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This machine makes great waffles, easy to use and easy to clean. Size of the waffles is perfect. The only problem I have with it is that it is sometimes very difficult to remove the waffle, they come apart in the middle and each side of the waffle sticks to the cooking surface. With the recipe I use, it also takes about 8 minutes to cook a waffle through. BUT when they are done, and they do not stick they are perfect waffles! Waffles are a weekend treat at our house and I would recommend this machine. Just be aware that the waffles need to be thoroughly cooked, when they are, they are far less likely to stick.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look no further, this is your best bet for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little waffle maker. I absolutely love it. It's my new favorite kitchen gadget. I use it not only for Belgian waffles, but French toast made with brioche, "waffinis" which is my take on a panini. I have also made an omelet in it. And I have yet to have anything stick to the cooking surface. It is super easy to clean as well. I have used this waffle maker just about every day since I got it. I love that it folds up slim for storage. Look no further, this is your best bet for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Limited.Edition

customer_reviews.title: Actually love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Presto Belgian waffle iron that I've gotten. The first one broke when the plastic thing broke so it wouldn't stand up straight. Then the actual cover on the motor cracked. I actually dropped the iron so it was my fault. I continued using it for years as the iron still worked. Finally I couldn't keep it together anymore and decided it was time to look for another one. I ended up purchasing the same iron. Without paying a large amount of $$$, it's perfect. I'll just be more careful when putting it away. It's easy to clean, great timer (my old iron timer died also) so you know when to flip the iron. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sher

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: I just melt some coconut oil and put it in the batter, instead of using a cooking spray. Then the waffle iron barely takes any cleaning afterwards. The temperature is very consistent. Really this is a mindless, enjoyable experience. Perfect, big waffles every time. Highly recommended. I use a paleo waffle mix that takes more like 6 minutes to fully cook (4 on one side, 2 on the other). Just play with the timing til you get your preferred golden brown. It's easy to check midway after a few minutes :)
customer_reviews.author: N. Meador

customer_reviews.title: I'm loving it.
customer_reviews.text: I used to travel so much that I pretty much got my fill of hotel waffles. After staying home for the past couple of years, I actually started missing having waffles. This waffle maker has filled a need that I didn't even know I had. LOL. It's easy to use and it hasn't required any cleaning, other than a quick wipe down. I set the timer for 4 minutes and my waffle comes out perfectly each time. A bonus that I would never have thought about, is how good my house smells after cooking just a single waffle.
customer_reviews.author: L. South

customer_reviews.title: First waffle maker, and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these at the beginning of quarantine, and I am so happy I did. I had never owned a waffle maker before, so I wanted something easy. It’s easy to use, easy to clean, and the waffles are sooo delicious. I use krusteaz Belgian waffle mix and the waffles are amazing every time. I have started adding fruit and other toppings. Next I think I will try cornbread waffles. If you are looking for a less expensive waffle maker that still makes perfect waffles every time, then look no further. Buy it. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best waffle maker I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: this is by far the best waffle maker I’ve ever owned. It’s the closest thing to having Hotel waffles at home I have ever seen. It makes a perfect waffle every time, which is new for me. It’s sort of a dummy proof that way. I’ve use several different box mixes as well as made from scratch recipes and they all turn out beautifully. The built-in timer is handy, but the best part is it is so easy to clean you just wipe it and put away. Excellent nonstick surface, No cooking spray needed.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Kinzler

customer_reviews.title: Anemic waffles
customer_reviews.text: We have owned several of this brand and model of waffle maker and have always been able to make fantastic waffles. Every time they were golden brown and crisp. When our old Presto waffle maker died I ordered the same model, however this one could not repeat the performance of the previous ones. No matter what we tried, the waffles came out pale, anemic and soft. We were seriously disappointed. In the past we have made thousands of wonderful waffles until this unit. One thing I did notice was the plates are different. The older units had black plates, these were a dark grey and looked like the outer material was different.
customer_reviews.author: Sven Katornson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, thick waffles!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a thick Belgian waffle maker and the search is over. Arrived last night. Made waffles this morning. All the waffles turned out amazing! Has a timer to use for cooking. About 3 minutes turned out to be the right cooking time. But I found by ready other post to really just watch for the steam coming out the sides and that truly is the best indicator the waffle is done. The waffles are nice and thick. The flip feature provides a beautiful golden brown coloring. If I could give more than 5 stars I would!!
customer_reviews.author: AngelReznor

customer_reviews.title: An honest review...
customer_reviews.text: OK so ive had this product for several months now and overall I'd have to say this was a good buy. If youre like me you wanna hear all the "bad" first so here it goes... The bad the iron has trouble heating evenly so it's difficult to get picture perfect waffles at the approximate listed cooking times. Try cooking them for about a min less but even this isnt perfect all the time. The vertical stand tabs are flimsy and dont stay. The good For the price you cant beat it, it's ez to clean (just make sure you spray with oil), and it makes waffles just fine. I'd defiantly buy it again knowing what i know now.
customer_reviews.author: Just2tyte

customer_reviews.title: Love that you can flip big waffles but it's still compact
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these because the price is so good and it makes large waffles with deep pockets, not like the smaller shallow ones that some cheaper waffle makers produce. Now we can make two waffles at the same time for family gatherings and have hot crispy waffles quicker. Would definitely order again we have had no issue so far. as others have mentioned it's a little silly the timer is battery operated instead of getting its power supply from the main unit.. but whatever. A unique design that saves space and still flips the waffle.
customer_reviews.author: DougDTX

customer_reviews.title: NO TEFLON TASTE/NO STICK
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRESTO FLIP WAFFLE MAKER IS NICER THAN EXPECTED. NOTHING STICKS. WIPE CLEAN. NO FOUL TEFLON TASTE WITH THE CERAMIC GRIDS. AM USING 2-3 TIMES A WEEK. ONE CUP OF BATTER PER INSTRUCTIONS FOR PERFECT WAFFLE. POUR IT IN AND FLIP-DONE WHEN IT STOPS STEAMING. IT STORES UPRIGHT SO NICELY IN ABOUT 4 INCHES OF SPACE. THE TIMER IS JUST TO ALERT ME-NOT TO STOP THE THE COOKING-SO I ALWAYS SET IT WHILE I MULTITASK THE BACON OR SAUSAGE. IF I WANT TO HOLD AND WARM THEM UP, I JUST LET THEM SIT IN THE IRON AND TURN BACK ON TO REHEAT IF THEY'VE COOLED DOWN TOO MUCH. BUT THEY STAY HOT LOOOONG TIME JUST SITTING THERE. HAPPY BUYER.
customer_reviews.author: skf

customer_reviews.title: Makes great waffles, literally WIPES clean, but the timer died after a while
customer_reviews.text: Makes perfect waffles every single time, and whatever they make the nonstick out of is unreal--we don't spray it at all ever, the butter in the batter is enough to make every waffle release every time. When you're done cooking you just wipes it off with a dry paper towel. The vertical storage is handy but not a big deal. The timer was surprisingly handy, but then it died after about a year. We just use a regular kitchen timer now, the waffles still come out great but it's one more step to do.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy all around. No temperature controls, no cleanup, comes with a great recipe for basic waffles, and has a timer built in. I've only had it for less than a week and have made waffles with it every day. I made the 4 servings as recommended and just pour one waffle and put the rest in the fridge. Once done, I unplug, wipe off with a paper towel and stand it up and put it in its place. And best of all, the waffles are better than any you will get with a pre-made waffle batter. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Guntario

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I love the 'flip' type waffle makers, I feel like they cook more evenly. The non-stick coating should last a long time as long as we don't use anything abrasive. Honestly, we have simply taken a plastic spatula to pick out any remnants and give it a good wipe to clean the machine. The waffle recipe that comes with the package uses oil, so I opted to find one on Allrecipes.com to find one that uses melted butter instead. If you want a Belgian style fluffy waffle, do yourself a favor and purchase this maker.
customer_reviews.author: JPII

customer_reviews.title: Restaurant quality Belgium waffles!
customer_reviews.text: While the breville waffle maker looked amazing, I couldn't spend $100+ on a waffle maker that I'll probably only use once a month. The Presto waffle maker was reasonably priced and had excellent reviews, so I gave it a try. Works great and the Belgium waffles came out looking like a restaurant. Super happy with my purchase. I'd say the only downside is that this maker doesn't have removable plates to make cleaning easier, but I knew that when I purchased it. With that said, I'm happy to save the money and deal with non removable plates. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Love this waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just about perfect. You plug it in. Mix up your waffles. Pour in 3/4ish cup of mix, and a few minutes later you got perfect waffles. Could not be a better experience. I love that it flips just like a real waffle maker, but is compact in storage. I see the complaints about the timer not controlling the heat, but I like it fine as-is. Your mileage may vary, but I'm very pleased with my purchase and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: PeterK

customer_reviews.title: I know that every waffle I make on it is going to be perfect. Proven over at least 6 uses since buy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Flipside which simply stopped heating after 3 years after it's first use. I bought a different type of waffle maker that I have since given away. Nothing replaces a Belgium waffle. alas the one I gave away produced wimpy, somewhat soggy flat waffles so it had to go. I purchased this Flipside because even if it doesn't last any longer than the last, I know that every waffle I make on it is going to be perfect. Proven over at least 6 uses since buy. Great waffle maker for the price.
customer_reviews.author: happy2share

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Waffles, Easy To Make
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I suggest you wipe the inside of the waffle iron first with a damp rag and then heat the waffle iron up for about 5 to 7 minutes. Then open it up, wipe with a damp rag again, and let it cool. This will remove any chemical smell and enable you to make pristine waffles right after you complete this process. Waffles come out beautifully and are easy to remove. Clean-up is easy too. The vertical storage feature is a nice add.
customer_reviews.author: StraightArrow

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: Great GREAT waffle iron. Mix up some batter and I've found for me that 2:30 on one side and 2:30 on the other is perfect. Does not have any sort of fancy bells and whistles that automatically tell you when its done but you get the hang of it after a few batches. Also... AMAZING for storage, takes up so little space its crazy and seems like its going to be very long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: SDKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Belgian waffles
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this waffle maker. It doesn't heat evenly on both sides. I make waffles often and my old Oster (20 years old) stopped working. The only good feature on this waffle iron is the non stick grids. Its clumsy to use. Cross Presto products off my list.
customer_reviews.author: tea wisdom

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price !
customer_reviews.text: Okay so trying to choose a waffle iron on amazon can take some time , I mainly was looking for a basic waffle iron (waffles , hash browns , broccoli hash browns , omelet) I have made them all in this and they turned out amazing takes some time but once heated up it’s good to go ! To clean this I add some water after I’m done to pull up some of the food (berries broccoli so forth ) then it takes a few minutes to wipe it out but I don’t mind for the price ! (Have used it 20+ times )
customer_reviews.author: Pmech

customer_reviews.title: Waffles stick
customer_reviews.text: I definitely enjoy this waffle maker and it makes great waffles! I thought it was supposed to have a nonstick surface however, most of my waffles stick and then crumble when I try to take them off of the surface. I'm not sure if i'm supposed to but I use coconut oil spray in between each waffle which seems to work! I just wish it was nonstick! Also, it is pretty hard to clean after they stick to the surface of the waffle maker! Makes good waffles though if I spray!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Greinermiller

customer_reviews.title: Great, affordable waffle iron
customer_reviews.text: This review is long overdue. The waffle iron makes excellent waffles, and the non-stick surface is still going strong after a year of use. The weak spots are the timer which I don't even use anymore, and the clip that holds it upright. It's actually useless since the slightest bump on the unit will cause it to release. Not a deal breaker, but I'm just pointing out a failed bit of engineering. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Greenie95125

customer_reviews.title: Thick Belgian Waffles Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly NON-STICK waffle iron. The waffles come out without any sticking to the cooking surfaces. The timer beeps to notify you that the timer will go off in one minute. The temperature is NOT adjustable, only the baking time. This may or may not be acceptable to the batter you use. The book advises and we found correct that a cooking time of 4 minutes is correct for most waffle recipes. We are very pleased with this waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Clean! Super Big Waffles!!
customer_reviews.text: Works just as advertised. I'm really happy with this BUT please do note the size of the waffles this thing makes. I honestly didn't think they were that big, but man, this thing makes a pretty nice sized waffle. I'm a guy and just 1 is enough for me. Otherwise, pretty simple to use, easy to clean, if even necessary, and the fact that you can stand it vertical for easy storage is a plus! Do recommend!
customer_reviews.author: A. Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Not crisp
customer_reviews.text: There's no temp control, so your only ability to control the cooking is via time. After 7 minutes, the exterior of the waffle was fairly brown, but burned towards the edges. The exterior was not very crisp. If I had a temperature control, I'd turn it down a bit and leave the waffle in longer to dry out the exterior.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Weak waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. I used to have a waffle maker just like this one and it made perfect waffles. It was the same brand, the same model number, except it was 1500 watts. I went through the pain of spending days to find out the brand and model number and then I ordered what I though was the best waffle iron. It’s just not the case. It is not a powerful waffle maker. Apparently it is 1200 or 1250 watts and it doesn’t heat up hot enough. WHICH MAKES THE WAFFLES SOFT and NOT CRISPY. It TOTALLY SUCKS.
customer_reviews.author: Alla

customer_reviews.title: My go to for a gold breakfast!
customer_reviews.text: My go-to for an easy breakfast We had this waffle maker several years ago, but it got lost when we moved houses. I tried a cheap on from a garage sale that did the job but the waffles were never as fluffy as they were with this waffle maker. So when that one broke, I went back to this one. I think the secret is the flip function. I also really like the timer function, as sometimes I would forget to put a timer on and burn the waffle!
customer_reviews.author: Kcs seattle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent waffles with a no-brainer waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about a waffle maker with no temperature control, but the fixed temperature of this one worked just fine. I used Sam Sifton's recipe from New York Times Cooking - a little more than one cup of batter, about five minutes until very little steam was still escaping, and the waffles were excellent. When locked in the upright position, the waffle maker takes very little room in my cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Ralphson

customer_reviews.title: Great Belgian waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I looked around a lot before deciding on the Presto 03510 unit. I like the ceramic coating on the plates. It makes cleaning up very easy. I really like the fold up storage feature--it fits perfectly in our cabinet above the oven with a small footprint compared to most other waffle makers. This is a simple but very effective waffle maker. You just pour in about 3/4 cup of batter, close the lid, and flip it over and wait about 4 minutes (the time my batter stops steaming). I get consistent waffles that are cooked evenly on both sides. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Size16

customer_reviews.title: deceptive  disscription  of product
customer_reviews.text: the description of this product was deceptive. It does not have a ceramic interior . I caklled presto and they informed me another outfit made the interior and they told me it not ceramic but sprayed with some other coating . They would not tell me what. They said they were not responsible for what presto puts on the box I am returning the product
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Great product just about to buy a second one for our sons apartment
customer_reviews.text: We purchased many years ago the kitchen aid and nearly bought that one as we knew it. And was impressed however at a fraction of the cost decided to try this as it was less Buick and also turned. So glad we did much less bulky easier to use and a fraction of the cost it also feels nicer and not so commercial. Would def recommend so far we have made savory fully loaded waffles with potato bacon and cheese and sweet choc chip waffles asl have gone down a a storm we have liked this product so much we are purchasing a second one for our sons apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Peni-FL

customer_reviews.title: Update!!!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions to the letter from the very beginning. The waffle iron worked fine for the first uses and then the batter began to stick. The instructions cautioned not to use oil on the grates; however a Presto representative explained that I could brush some on the grates to stop sticking and it didn't work, the batter still sticks. I guess I am out of 40.00 because the waffles made with this iron are not athetically pleasing at all. I have to literally pull the waffle out of the grates with a fork. I will have to purchase another waffle iron, this time from a company other than Presto.
customer_reviews.author: Pamella R.

customer_reviews.title: You don't need to use oil spray, etc.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this 3 times the first day I got it! Lol. You dint need cooking spray or oil to coat before use. And it's stays clean. Just wipe it with a paper towel or damp cloth. I haven't had issues with the batter sticking or anything. And they're hard to burn. I've put them on for 5 minutes and walked away and they were all good! Just a little crunchy. But it might depend on your recipe too. Anyway, my fav waffle maker so far! I'll update in a few months if that changes.
customer_reviews.author: Michele R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: It works perfect. I use Aunt Jemima pancake mix and followed those instructions. They cooked in about 2 mins. The only thing I disliked is the timer. It was tricky to use. You have to start it once you put the batter in. It would not set for 2 mins and I panicked because I didn't want to burn in so I just used my stovetop timer. It was perfect. I suggest pouring 3/4 to 1 cup of batter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use, clean and stored!
customer_reviews.text: I started to look for a waffle machine after I went to a brunch spot and paid $15 for a waffle. After a long search and I finally bought this flip waffle machine. The first two times I used it, the waffles came out not right. I then change to a different waffle mix, ever since the waffles are done perfectly! It is super easy to use, it is got a built-in timer. It is also very easy to clean. It can be stored vertically which makes it even better!
customer_reviews.author: Cozilla

customer_reviews.title: Splitting Waffles After 5 Uses, Is Milk To Blame?
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker made about three perfect waffles, until they started sticking and splitting. Buyer Beware - I have never used any oils or soaps. The only culprit is the Silk Protein Almond & Cashew Milk that I use for batter, which has gums and oils in the ingredients list. Don't use any milks that contain oils with this waffle maker! Is there any way to clean this thing?
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect waffles every time! *dont Use any spray/nonstick on this waffle maker* My step-by-step: mix waffle batter & I let batter sit 1-3 min to thicken up,plug in closed waffle maker, set timer to 4 minutes, pour 1cup batter evenly, close and flip completely to the other side, warm syrup in microwave and beep* waffles are done! I just wipe with damp rag after each use and once unit is cooled down. I’ve used this a few times a week and love it so much! I can’t believe I never got it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Makes a perfect Belgium Waffle
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I love that it makes perfect Belgium waffles and in 4 minutes. Out of curiosity, I also tried making an Omelet in it and to my surprise it cooked up nicely, just like a waffle. Cook time about 3&1/2 - 4 minutes. The only reason temperature control received 4 stars is because technically there is no temperature control knob to control the temperature. I love this Waffle maker and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Anita VanHaitsma

customer_reviews.title: Bought two of them, and the wife says there amazing
customer_reviews.text: Turns out great, thick, Belgian waffles cooked evenly. The vertical storage tab is great . It helps a lot with saving space. That way we where able to get two of them that store away in less space than just one of other models. The waffles come of clean leaving a easy to wipe down surface. The cooking surfaces are not removable and it is not machine washable but that's just fine.
customer_reviews.author: DLopan

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was hoping for!
customer_reviews.text: OMGOSH I am in love! I’ve waited my entire adult life (I just turned 62) to buy a waffle maker! I was given an Amazon gift card for my recent birthday and after reading the reviews decided to treat myself with this lovely item. I Put it to the test this morning, used the recipe that was included and I was not disappointed! The waffles were so light, fluffy and delicious. And I didn’t use the”fluffy” recipe! Looking forward to years of enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: Dkraay

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Presto 03510 Ceramic Flipside Belgian Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: The Ceramic Flipside Belgian Waffle Maker is easy to use; makes absolutely great waffles. I used the recipe for making pecan waffles (I love pecans!) included in the instruction booklet and each waffle turned out evenly brown and oh, were they so tasty! I love the fact that the waffle maker can be stored upright which is a great space saver on my kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: Marie W.

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I’m seriously excited about this one. I had come across a recipe that used protein powder instead of flour and I wanted to try it. I looked around for the best one, and ended up getting this one. I love how little space it takes up. Storing vertically is brilliant! It’s so easy to use. I was concerned with it being difficult to clean without having removable plates, so just don’t overfill it and you’ll be fine. I’m so glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rosela

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly made waffles every time
customer_reviews.text: I pre-heat, then mix one batch of Krusteaz (2 cups, 1.5 cups water, 1 egg, 2TBsp oil). The cook for 4 minutes. They come out perfect every time. Sometimes I even throw in some frozen blueberries. Better than any breakfast ordered at a restaurant.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Why oh why did I wait so long to get one of these?? These thing is awesome. So easy to use, the waffles come out so fluffy. Kids absolutely loved them. The waffle maker itself is completely clean after use, no residue.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Y

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This really deserves 4.5 stars, but i'm happy with it. Pros: Cooks a waffle in about 4 minutes. So far nothing sticks to it at all. Cons: The outside can get pretty hot. The plastic in the base doesn't inspire confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement waffle maker!
customer_reviews.text: Prior to getting this waffle maker, I had one for about 30 years. I was hesitant to get a new one, because I was afraid it wouldn’t live up to my expectations- but this Presto definitely did. I chose this one because it stored upright & right now I don’t have a lot of kitchen space. This Presto made great waffles from the 1st time I used it & it’s super easy to clean. Do I recommend it- absolutely!
customer_reviews.author: Judith D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, the perfect waffle!
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding product! They make waffles the perfect crispy/soft consistency - I’ve had waffles made by other waffle Makers at family/friends houses and theirs come out floppy and never seem to crisp up. My only complaint is the timer stopped working on the waffle maker after only having it for a month but it’s not anything that affects the quality of the waffles. I just use my microwave timer instead now!
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Chemical flavored waffles, yuck!
customer_reviews.text: The product worked fine. This product says no chemicals to leach into the food because of its ceramic coating. After 5 batches or 15 waffles we still could not eat them because of the overwhelming chemical flavor it imparted into the waffles. So very disappointed! What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: victoria packer

customer_reviews.title: It makes waffles...
customer_reviews.text: I dont know why it asked about temperature control since there isn't any but it works fine at whatever temperature it's pre-set at. A little deeper than my old waffle maker so it makes 4 on a regular 5 batch. The plastic piece that holds it upright is a little loose so you have to put it back up if you move it or bump it. Outside that no complaints. Cleans easy. Makes waffles.
customer_reviews.author: Japdawap

customer_reviews.title: This is the best waffler maker ever!
customer_reviews.text: I never have time to leave reviews but I feel I needed to leave this one here and say this is the most amazing waffler maker ever! I have had a couple of others before and they all gave me headaches. This one is the best! The waffles thickness and consistency is perfect. It cleans so easy and the system is great. I am very very very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lepacol

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: Great little Belgian Waffle Maker. Very surprised because it wasn't a super expensive item but it sure makes great waffles. I used the Krusteez Waffle Mix and they turned out perfect the first time and the 3 other times since I have used it. Cleans up with just a wipe and stores easily. I would only recommend the maker put a metal clip instead of plastic to store the item. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda - Southern California

customer_reviews.title: No more greasy cooking spray!
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a new waffle maker. Our old one always emitted a nasty chemical smell from the non-stick plates. The old one was also a greasy mess form the cooking spray that was required to keep the waffles from sticking. The Presto isn't like the old one. The Presto is clean (no cooking spray, and no sticking), makes awesome waffles, and doesn't stink-up the house. I'd recommend this product to anyone who wants to make great waffles.
customer_reviews.author: Charles J Hess

customer_reviews.title: Great Waffle Maker That I had To Return...
customer_reviews.text: Even though I had to return this I would recommend it. The problem with mine is that the timer stopped working. Not sure if it needed a battery or if it was hard wired but it just simply stopped and I know that others have complained about this and also there seems to be a lot of preowned ones out there with the same issue. Is it battery related or just a defect I wonder... Other than that the ceramic on these is AWESOMELY EXCELLENT and heats very uniformly. I hated to have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: aMANazon

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I got the ceramic version and so far I like it very much. Easy to clean, makes good waffles. Matter in fact I don't really clean it since the waffles just pop out. I don't use the timer though. The only one problem I have found is the read plastic thing that holds the waffle maker straight up for storing. When putting it away or putting other things away I have touched it and it falls down pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: LadyE

customer_reviews.title: Really is non stick, and perfect golden brown!
customer_reviews.text: This was kind of a luxery purchase, since I def don't make waffles every weekend. It does work great though. The waffles come out the perfect golden brown and I've never had a problem with sticking. I only use it once or twice a month, so I have a feeling it's going to last me a very long time too!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Morgin

customer_reviews.title: Great Belgian waffle maker!
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of comparison shopping, I settled on purchasing the Presto. I’m sure glad I did. This waffle iron is sturdy, easy to use and makes beautiful waffles. The recommended time was 4 minutes but we like our waffles crispy. The perfect time for our waffles is 6-7 minutes. I used a little more than 3/4 cup, thick batter. Does not have temperature control, but that’s ok. Has a timer that counts down. Delicious waffles!
customer_reviews.author: ajruby96

customer_reviews.title: Review for your Health
customer_reviews.text: I just got my product and was super excited to use it the same day until I see that using this product can cause CANCER. It says on the box, WARNING- "This product can expose you to chemicals including styrene, which are known to the state of CA to cause CANCER. I don't need any more health issues so y'all can use it AT YOUR OWN RISK. I hope the return is easy. Also I am happy the company warned us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pregnant lady needs waffles!
customer_reviews.text: Throughout my pregnancy, I've wanted waffles so we ordered this waffle iron. It's been great. It works well, it's easy to clean, and we LOVE that it stores upright. We aren't big on kitchen gadgets largely due to the fact that so many of them are space-hogs but we've loved this. We have also taken it with us when traveling for cabin weekends/trips with friends and it's been a real hit. It's held up well and makes a very tasty waffle.
customer_reviews.author: Kait

customer_reviews.title: Still like it a year & half later.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a year and a half ago. Great product. Do NOT use nonstick spray on it. We unknowingly sprayed it, and it took a long time to pick off the burnt on spray. Works great with nothing, but even better with a little melted butter brushed on. If you use the standard half or third of a cup of oil in your mix, you definitely do not need to grease it first. (Great for grilled cheese sandwiches too!)
customer_reviews.author: Niki the Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Have never owned a waffle maker but thought I would give this a try. I am not a gadget person at all! This product is so easy to use, to clean and to store. I love it! So glad I made the purchase. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Moore

product_meta.title: Presto 03510 Ceramic FlipSide Belgian Waffle Maker,Black
